SENT.plain: An approximately 20-year-old to 30-year-old patient presented with a haemodynamically stable supraventricular tachycardia
The patient was managed with intravenous adenosine primarily, with two bolus doses of 6 and 12 mg
This, however, caused a rare paradoxical surge of tachycardia with mild haemodynamic compromise
The patient further required a combination of Metoprolol and Verapamil administration to slow down and reverse the arrhythmia
Following this the patient remained stable with no further episodes till discharge
